    • Method Detail

      • add

        public static lexa.core.data.DataArray add(lexa.core.data.DataArray array,
                                           java.lang.Object... values)
        Implementation of the add function.

        Add a series of values to a DataArray. If the array does not exist then a new array is created with the values and if no values are provided then the original array is returned.

        Parameters:
        array - an array to add values to.
        values - the values to add to the array
        Returns:
        the array with the values added.

      • addFunction

        private static FunctionDefinition addFunction()

      • array

        public static lexa.core.data.DataArray array(java.lang.Object... values)
        Implementation of the array function.

        Create a DataArray from a set of values

        Parameters:
        values - the values to make into an array
        Returns:
        the array with all the values.

        Implementation of the clone function for an array.

        Create a clone of a DataArray

        Parameters:
        array - the array to clone
        Returns:
        a clone of the original array

      • cloneDataSet

        public static java.lang.Object cloneDataSet(lexa.core.data.DataSet dataSet)
        Implementation of the clone function for a data set.

        Create a clone of a DataSet

        Parameters:
        dataSet - the data set to clone
        Returns:
        a clone of the original data set

      • cloneFunction

        private static FunctionDefinition cloneFunction()
        A function to clone a DataSet.

        This is called using: 

        [data.clone name]
        Returns:
        the clone function

      • contains

        public static java.lang.Boolean contains(lexa.core.data.DataSet data,
                                         java.lang.String key)
        Implementation of the contains function.

        Find if a data set contains a value for the given key

        Parameters:
        data - the data set to check
        key - the key to the item to be found
        Returns:
        true if an item exists for the key, otherwise false.

      • containsFunction

        private static FunctionDefinition containsFunction()
        A function to find if a dataset contains a key

        This is called using: 

        [data.clone name key]
        Returns:
        true if the item exists.

      • getFunctions

        public static FunctionDefinition[] getFunctions()
        Get the data functions
        Returns:
        the data functions

      • joinArray

        public static lexa.core.data.DataArray joinArray(lexa.core.data.DataArray first,
                                                 lexa.core.data.DataArray second)
        Implementation of the join function for arrays.

        Create a DataArray by joining two arrays together

        Parameters:
        first - the first array
        second - the second array
        Returns:
        a new array containing both input arrays.

      • joinDataSet

        public static lexa.core.data.DataSet joinDataSet(lexa.core.data.DataSet first,
                                                 lexa.core.data.DataSet second)
        Implementation of the join function for data sets.

        Create a DataSet by joining two data sets together. If a key is repeated then the item from second will replace the item from first.

        Parameters:
        first - the first data set
        second - the second data set
        Returns:
        a new data set containing both input data sets.

      • joinFunction

        private static FunctionDefinition joinFunction()

      • key

        public static java.lang.String key(lexa.core.data.DataSet data,
                                   java.lang.Integer index)
        Implementation of the key function.

        Find the key for the item at index position. If the index is out of range then returns null

        Parameters:
        data - the data set
        index - the position in the data set.
        Returns:
        If the index is valid then DataItem.getKey() for the item, otherwise returns null.

      • keyFunction

        private static FunctionDefinition keyFunction()

      • mapFunction

        private static FunctionDefinition mapFunction()

      • remove

        public static java.lang.Object remove(lexa.core.data.DataSet data,
                                      lexa.core.data.DataItem item)
        Implementation of the remove function.

        Remove an item from the data set either by key or index. If the input is a string then it is removed by key and if it is an integer then it is removed by index.

        Parameters:
        data - the data set
        item - the item in the data set, either a key or index
        Returns:
        If the item is removed then DataItem.getObject() for the item, otherwise returns null.

      • removeFunction

        private static FunctionDefinition removeFunction()

      • size

        private static java.lang.Integer size(lexa.core.data.DataItem item)

      • sizeFunction

        private static FunctionDefinition sizeFunction()

      • value

        static java.lang.Object value(lexa.core.data.DataSet data,
                              lexa.core.data.DataValue value)
        Get a value from a data set
        Parameters:
        data - data to search
        value - the value required, either a string for the key or integer for index.
        Returns:
        the requested value or null if not present.

      • valueFunction

        private static FunctionDefinition valueFunction()
